com.wingfoot.xml.schema.types
Class SimpleContent

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.wingfoot.xml.schema.types.SimpleContent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Content
public class SimpleContent
extends java.lang.Object
implements Content

Defines a <simpleContent> content model for a complex type. A simpleContent content model is used to create a complex type that extends or restricts an existing SimpleType or XSDType and defines one or more attributes.

getDerivation

public int getDerivation()
Returns the derivation of the SimpleContent.
Specified by:
getDerivation in interface Content
Returns:
int the derivation; it is either Content.RESTRICTION or Content.EXTENSION.

getBaseType

public TypeReference getBaseType()
Returns the base type of the content model. After the <simpleContent> element, a <restriction> or an <extension> element is required. This element identifies the base type (via the base attribute) that is being extended or restricted.
Specified by:
getBaseType in interface Content
Returns:
Type the base type of the content model.

setBaseType

public void setBaseType(TypeReference newBaseType)
Sets the base type of the content model. The content model either restricts or extends this base type. In a schema after the <simpleContent> element, a <restriction> or an <extension> element is required. This element identifies the base type (via the base attribute) that is being extended or restricted.
Specified by:
setBaseType in interface Content
Parameters:
newBaseType - Type encapsulating the base type that is restricted or extended.

              throws SchemaException
Sets the facet for the SimpleContent. For a the facets are applicable only if the derivation is Content.RESTRICTION.
Parameters:
name - value pairs of facets.
Throws:
SchemaException - if the derivation is not Content.RESTRICTION

addContent

public void addContent(Component newContent)
                throws SchemaException
Adds a component to the conetnt. For simpleCompoent the following rules apply
  • if the derivation is Content.EXTENSION then the legal Component is either a SimpleType, Attribute or AttributeGroupDefinition;
  • if the derivation is Content.RESTRICTION then the legal Component is either a SimpleType, Attribute or AttributeGroupDefinition;

    If the content for the simpleContent is empty (ie this method is never called) OR if the content contains only Attribute and AttributeGroup then the content defaults to the value of the base attribute (ie the value specified using the setType attribute).

    Specified by:
    addContent in interface Content
    Parameters:
    attribute - the attribute to add to the content model
    Throws:
    SchemaException - if the newComponent is an illegal component. The legal components are listed above.
